page.title: 09LONGFORGAN - CHURCH -
page.content: The Church which occupies a prominent site in the village of Longforgan is the descendant of the Church believed to have been established nearly 1400 years ago by Modwenna a disciple of St.Patrick. Today it is not only a place of worship where 30%-40% of the community gather Sunday by Sunday but it is a focal point for community activities during the week. Accommodation is provided for 6 youth organisations, the Women's Guild, Senior Citizens and other groups from time to time. It was due to the interest of the minister and the congregation, that a 'Meals on Wheels' service was established. Visits to hospitals can be arranged and carried out by the Elders. Longforgan shares its minister with 3 other parishes in the district, thus keeping open some very fine country Churches.
